metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1091 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the flush_tmregs_to_thread function in arch/powerpc/kernel/ptrace.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13.5, a guest kernel crash can be triggered from unprivileged userspace during a core dump on a POWER host due to a missing processor feature check and an erroneous use of transactional memory (TM) instructions in the core dump path, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1091` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
